body:
Mitmproxy == 11.0.2
python == 3.11

The above error occurred when trying to capture the traffic of android application of Pintrest.

Thank you for the report. This is a bug in the savehar addon: Accessing `.content` [can raise](https://docs.mitmproxy.org/stable/api/mitmproxy/http.html#Message.content), and the addon should handle that. Contributions welcome!
Glad you raised! I was looking for the fix as well.

issue.title: Failing to parse compressed (gzipped) responses

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
#### Description

<!-- describe your changes here -->

#### Checklist

 - [ ] I have updated tests where applicable.
 - [ ] I have added an entry to the CHANGELOG.

It got fixed by the author.

This is still unfixed, not sure what @s9807 is talking about. https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/issues/7452#issuecomment-2575161740 still describes what we want to change.

do i need to add 
`flow.error = f"Invalid content encoding for {flow.id}: {str(e)}"` 
line in except block of `flow_entry` method of https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/blob/main/mitmproxy/addons/savehar.py?
or need other method to handle error?
I'd be glad if you give some little bit more clarification.
thanks!
